definitions.definition: used when you are reacting to something that has been said, especially if you did not know it before

examples.text: ‘I saw Ben yesterday.’ ‘Oh yes, how is he?’
You can’t come tonight? Oh well, see you next week then.
‘Emma has a new job.’ ‘Oh, has she?’

definitions.definition: used to express surprise, fear, joy, etc.

examples.text: Oh, Sue! Could you help me a moment?

definitions.definition: used when you are thinking of what to say next

examples.text: I've been in this job for, oh, about six years.
